title: Biden’s State of the Union Speech Will Cast Trump as Bent on Revenge
description: President Joe Biden will look to turn aside doubts over his age in the State of the Union address by accusing his presumptive Republican opponent - former President Donald Trump - of posing a danger to American democracy.

title: Kyrsten Sinema Rules Out Third-Party Presidential Run in 2024
description: Independent Senator Kyrsten Sinema of Arizona ruled out a third-party presidential run on the No Labels ticket, the latest prominent centrist to do so.

title: IMF Chief Georgieva Poised to Win Key Support for Second Term
description: Kristalina Georgieva is interested in a second five-year term as head of the International Monetary Fund and is poised to secure sufficient support, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Biden’s State of the Union Carries Heavy Election-Year Burden
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, deputy White House editor Justin Sink looks at what’s at stake for the president as he delivers his State of the Union address. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: China Envoy Li Hui Visits Ukraine and Meets With Zelenskiy Aide
description: Li Hui, the Chinese government’s special representative for Eurasian affairs, visited Ukraine and met with Andriy Yermak, chief of staff to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy, in Kyiv Thursday. It was the envoy’s second visit to Kyiv within a year.

title: UN Security Council Weighs Urging Haiti Elections as Chaos Grows
description: The United Nations Security Council is weighing a statement that would press for free and fair elections in Haiti without calling for Prime Minister Ariel Henry to resign, according to a draft obtained by Bloomberg News.

title: Trump Judge Orders Hush-Money Case Jurors’ Names Kept Secret
description: New York jurors in Donald Trump’s first criminal trial will have their names, addresses and other personal information kept secret to protect them from any tampering or backlash over their role in the politically charged case.

title: Need for New US LNG Exports Is ‘A Good Question,’ Biden Aide Says
description: A senior White House energy adviser said the need for new facilities to export liquefied natural gas abroad is an open question amid exponential growth in US shipments of the fuel abroad.

title: US Readies Push at UN to Warn Against Nuclear Weapons in Space
description: The US is preparing a United Nations Security Council resolution that would warn against deploying nuclear weapons in space, people familiar with the matter said, as it seeks to dissuade Russia from potential plans to put a warhead in orbit.

title: Venezuela Says Electoral Observers Are Invited to July Race
description: Venezuela’s electoral body said it invited eight international monitoring missions as questions surround the fairness of July’s presidential vote.

title: US Says Companies May Review Stance on Zimbabwe After Sanctions Shift
description: US businesses may re-examine their stance on Zimbabwe following the adoption of a new sanctions program which places only three entities and the nation’s top leaders including Zimbabwean President Emmerson Mnangagwa under restrictions.

title: Labour Trails Conservatives in Donations With Election in Sight
description: The UK’s poll-leading Labour Party said 2023 was its “best fund-raising year ever,” even as it trailed the governing Conservative Party in the latest figures published by the Electoral Commission.

title: Ghana’s Mahama, Ex-Education Minister Pair Up For December Vote
description: Ghana’s main opposition leader John Dramani Mahama picked Jane Naana Opoku-Agyemang, a former education minister, as his running mate for Dec. 7 presidential elections.

title: Venezuela Opposition Split on Who Will Challenge Maduro in July Election
description: Venezuela’s decision to hold presidential elections in July has sent shock waves through the opposition, which now has less than three weeks to find a challenger to Nicolás Maduro.

title: Biden to Direct Military to Establish Gaza Port to Deliver Aid
description: President Joe Biden is directing the US military to establish a temporary port on the Gaza coast to ramp up the delivery of aid and ease the humanitarian crisis in the territory sparked by the Israel-Hamas war, according to senior administration officials.

title: Biden Makes His 2024 Pitch: What to Watch in State of the Union
description: Stalled Ukraine aid. A deepening humanitarian crisis in Gaza. The looming November rematch with Donald Trump.

title: Sweden’s NATO Accession Unlocks Defense Options to Fend Off Russia
description: Sweden’s entry into NATO can help solve a critical problem for military planners mapping out the alliance’s defenses against a potential Russian attack: how to rapidly shuttle troops, weapons and other provisions to a front anywhere from the Baltic to the Arctic.

title: Germany and UK Vow Not to Let Putin Divide Ukraine’s Allies
description: Germany and the UK vowed not to let President Vladimir Putin drive a wedge between them after a Russian hack of German intelligence exposed a disagreement over how to provide military support to Ukraine.

title: Habeck Wants to Pressure States Benefiting From Russia Sanctions
description: Robert Habeck, Germany's economy and climate minister, at the Group of 20 investment summit in Berlin, Germany, on Monday, Nov. 20, 2023. German Chancellor Olaf Scholz pledged €4 billion ($4.4 billion) for the Africa-EU Green Energy Initiative through 2030 and said Europe’s biggest economy will import “a large proportion” of its green hydrogen needs from the continent. Photographer: Krisztian Bocsi/Bloomberg

title: Sweden Joins NATO to Complete Alliance’s Nordic Expansion
description: Sweden became the 32nd member of NATO, completing the defense alliance’s historic enlargement into the Nordic region, nearly two years after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine prompted the membership bid.

title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa Says Violence by Zuma Supporters Won’t be Tolerated
description: South Africa’s President Cyril Ramaphosa said members of a new party backed by his predecessor Jacob Zuma who have threatened unrest if it is excluded from May 29 elections will be arrested.

title: France Enters Defense Pact to Help Moldova Ward Off Russian Meddling
description: France agreed to a defense pact with Moldova to help boost security as the former Soviet republic, which neighbors Ukraine, braces for possible efforts by Russia aimed at derailing its plan to join the European Union.

title: Mnuchin Would Consider Serving Trump Again If He Wins
description: Steven Mnuchin, who served as Treasury secretary under former President Donald Trump, would consider serving again if the presumptive Republican nominee wins a second term.

title: Two Alabama Clinics Resume IVF After New Law Goes Into Effect
description: Two clinics in Alabama will resume in vitro fertilization treatment after Alabama Governor Kay Ivey signed a bill that protects clinics and fertility specialists from being prosecuted under the state’s Supreme Court ruling that embryos should be considered children.

title: Lula Slammed by Venezuela Opposition Candidate as Sexist
description: Venezuela presidential hopeful María Corina Machado fired back at Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva after he suggested she should appoint another candidate to run in her place in this year’s election.

title: German Government Extends Rosneft Trusteeship Until September
description: Germany will extend its trusteeship over the local subsidiaries of Russia’s state energy giant Rosneft PJSC for a third time, a step that will avoid the business being nationalized and help pave the way for Moscow’s sale of the entity.

title: Senegal’s Top Court Confirms March 24 Presidential Election Date
description: Senegal’s top court confirmed that presidential elections will take place on March 24, bringing an end to weeks of uncertainty over the polls.

title: John Kumah, Ghana’s Deputy Finance Minister, Dies at 45
description: John Kumah, who served as Ghana’s deputy finance minister since 2021, has died, the finance ministry said. He was 45.

title: Egypt Expects IMF Deal to Catalyze $20 Billion in Foreign Funds
description: Egypt expects its new International Monetary Fund deal to catalyze a total of $20 billion in foreign support for the troubled economy.

title: Trudeau’s Spring Budget Has Canadian Firms Worried About New Taxes
description: Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland’s upcoming budget has some in Canada’s business community concerned there will be tax increases to offset new government spending.

title: Fed Chair Powell Testifies Before the Senate
description: Jerome Powell Photographer: Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images

title: Hopes Fade of Gaza Cease-Fire Before Ramadan After Failed Talks
description: Efforts to secure a cease-fire in the Israel-Hamas war before the expected start of the Muslim holy month of Ramadan on Sunday appear to be failing, frustrating the delivery of urgent aid into Gaza and increasing the risk of a wider conflict.

title: Democrats Probe SpaceX Over Russia’s Alleged Use of Starlink
description: A pair of House Democrats are investigating SpaceX over claims that Russia is using the company’s Starlink internet terminals in its war against Ukraine.

title: NATO Invites Sweden to Join as Formal Entry Steps Proceed
description: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg has invited Sweden to accede to the North Atlantic Treaty as part of the final set of formal steps required for it to join NATO.

title: Down The Rabbit Hole: Unpicking Hunt's Budget
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Jeremy Hunt’s Budget Left British CEOs Wanting More
description: Jeremy Hunt boasted of returning business confidence and rising investment during Wednesday’s budget speech, yet a group of British CEOs said they’d been left disappointed by the Conservative government’s new measures.

title: Xi Urges Coordination of Military and Economic Strategy at Sea
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping called on the military to coordinate its maritime strategy with economic development, in a meeting with defense lawmakers during the country’s annual legislative session.

title: Middle East Powers Move to Bolster Egypt
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Trump to Seize Control of GOP Machine After Clinching Nomination
description: Donald Trump will tighten his grip on the GOP on Friday when his allies are poised to take control of the Republican National Committee at a meeting in Houston, Texas.

title: India Frees 10,000 More Soldiers to Guard Border With China
description: India has freed up thousands of soldiers to strengthen its disputed border with China, adding a potential irritant to its already sour relations with Beijing.

title: Senegal Eurobonds Jump as Sall Seeks Elections by End of March
description: Senegal’s dollar bonds advanced after the authorities announced that delayed elections will take place days before President Macky Sall’s mandate expires next month.

title: How Microsoft’s Bing Helps Maintain Beijing’s Great Firewall
description: The company’s search engine does good business in China, a market Google and Facebook abandoned years ago.

title: Billionaire, Corporate Tax Hikes Will Be Focus of Biden Speech
description: President Joe Biden will propose increasing the minimum tax rates paid by major US and multinational corporations to 21% and eliminating breaks for companies with high-paid executives in his election-year State of the Union address on Thursday night.

title: Brainard Pushed to Change Biden Budget Forecast to Rosier View
description: Joe Biden’s top economic aide, Lael Brainard, successfully pressed to adjust a White House forecast in a way that resulted in a slightly rosier outlook in the president’s forthcoming budget plan, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Modi Holds Election Rally in India’s Volatile Kashmir Region
description: In the run-up to the national elections, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi held a rare political rally in the northern region of Jammu and Kashmir Thursday, nearly five years after his government revoked its statehood and special status.

title: Labour Attacks Tory ‘Unfunded’ Plan to Ditch National Insurance
description: Keir Starmer’s opposition Labour Party took aim at the UK government’s “unfunded” ambition to abolish the national insurance payroll tax, as it sought to turn the tables on the governing Conservative Party in the build up to a general election expected in the second half of the year.

title: Biden Team to Lambaste Trump’s Economic Plans During Address
description: President Joe Biden’s campaign plans to ramp up attacks on Donald Trump’s economic agenda for a second term, a shift from its current focus on the former president’s actions when he occupied the White House.

title: Norway Advises Against Trade, Business With Israeli Settlements
description: The Norwegian government is discouraging the country’s companies from conducting trade and business activities that contribute to the maintenance of the Israeli settlements, underlining its existing stance.

title: EU Proposes New Russia Sanctions Over Death of Alexey Navalny
description: The European Union will propose new sanctions related to the death of the Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny in an arctic prison last month.

title: South Africa’s ANC To Pursue Prescribed Assets Plan After Vote
description: South Africa’s ruling African National Congress will forge ahead with plans to revive an apartheid-era rule compelling pension funds to plow money into certain government-approved investments, assuming it retains power in upcoming elections.

title: Russia Prepares for Long-Term Standoff in Baltic, Lithuania Says
description: Russia’s military is preparing for a protracted standoff with NATO member states in the Baltic Sea region as the Kremlin expands military capability westward, Lithuania’s spy agencies said.

title: Orban’s Feud With Central Bank Chief Triggers Investor Alarm
description: Prime Minister Viktor Orban has spent months pushing Hungary’s central bank to cut rates more aggressively and lift the country out of recession. The tension is tipping into open conflict.

title: South Korea Adds Funds for Emergency Care Staff During Walkout
description: South Korea will increase compensation for hospitals that kept emergency rooms running during a staff crunch caused by a doctors’ walkout and is advancing a plan to boost medical school enrollments, which sparked the labor action.

title: China Warns US ‘Absurdity’ On Trade Curbs Will Harm America
description: China’s foreign minister blasted the US for imposing a “bewildering” level of trade curbs on the Asian nation, as President Joe Biden’s efforts to block Beijing from advanced tech undermine a steadying of ties between the world’s two largest economies.

title: US Spends Big to Highlight Beijing’s Tactics in South China Sea
description: The US is spending hundreds of millions of dollars to develop maritime capabilities in Southeast Asia as nations face growing pressure from Beijing in the disputed South China Sea, a senior US official said.

title: WuXi AppTec, WuXi Bio Tumble After US Panel Advances Ban Bill
description: WuXi AppTec Co. tumbled after a US Senate committee advanced a bill that may ban Chinese biotech firms from accessing federal contracts and largely cut off the biopharmaceutical company from the market that generates more than half of its revenue.

title: Australia, Vietnam Upgrade Ties Amid US-China Rivalry
description: Australia has joined the US in elevating its diplomatic ties with Vietnam to the highest level as Canberra moves to strengthen links across the Asia Pacific against a backdrop of China’s rising regional influence.

title: Kim Jong Un Observes Training to Storm Border Posts in War Prep
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un oversaw military drills that included storming border guard posts, stepping up pressure on South Korea after saying he has the right to annihilate his neighbor and no longer seeks peaceful unification.

title: What Buzzwords From China’s Key Political Meeting Reveal, From ‘AI Plus’ to ‘New Three’
description: As lawmakers and advisers meet in Beijing this week for the nation’s biggest political gathering of the year, the Chinese Communist Party’s official People’s Daily newspaper released a list of the event’s buzzwords.
